title: 20 Turkey Trots You’ll Love to Run Around Thanksgiving
text:
Around a decade ago, Thanksgiving Day overtook the Fourth of July as the most popular day for road racing in the United States, officially making the Turkey Trot top dog. Or top turkey. That’s because nearly a million participants partake in over 1,000 races each November.

The races vary from city to city, though most top out at a 5k. But they can range anywhere from two miles to a half marathon, and many have become beloved annual traditions in local communities around the country (and around the world)—not to mention a much-needed calorie burner before gobbling down your Thanksgiving feast.

Just like your own traditions, each race is unique. But some are the mashed potatoes and green beans while others are all-day cooked turkey. That’s why we’ve compiled a rundown of some of the oldest, fastest, and most giving races on Turkey Day.

Can’t get yourself out to one of these classics? Check out our race finder for a Turkey Trot near you.
